member.summary: When set, this will limit the number of concurrent inbound calls to phone numbers associated with this connection.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Applications.Inbound.SipSubdomain
member.summary: Specifies a subdomain that can be used to receive Inbound calls to a Connection, in the same way a phone number is used, from a SIP endpoint. Example: the subdomain "example.sip.telnyx.com" can be called from any SIP endpoint by using the SIP URI "sip:@example.sip.telnyx.com" where the user part can be any alphanumeric value. Please note TLS encrypted calls are not allowed for subdomain calls.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Applications.Inbound.SipSubdomainReceiveSettings
member.summary: This option can be enabled to receive calls from: "Anyone" (any SIP endpoint in the public Internet) or "Only my connections" (any connection assigned to the same Telnyx user).

member.summary: When set, this will limit the number of concurrent outbound calls to phone numbers associated with this connection.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.ConnectionBase.DefaultOnHoldComfortNoiseEnabled
member.summary: When enabled, Telnyx will generate comfort noise when you place the call on hold. If disabled, you will need to generate comfort noise or on hold music to avoid RTP timeout.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.ConnectionBase.DtmfType
member.summary: Sets the type of DTMF digits sent from Telnyx to this Connection. Note that DTMF digits sent to Telnyx will be accepted in all formats Default RFC 2833

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.ConnectionBase.EncodeContactHeaderEnabled
member.summary: Encode the SIP contact header sent by Telnyx to avoid issues for NAT or ALG scenarios

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.ConnectionBase.EncryptedMedia
member.summary: Enable use of SRTP or ZRTP for encryption. Valid values are those listed or null. Cannot be set to non-null if the transport_portocol is TLS.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.ConnectionBase.Id
member.summary: Identifies the type of resource.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.ConnectionBase.OnnetT38PassthroughEnabled
member.summary: Enable on-net T38 if you prefer the sender and receiver negotiating T38 directly if both are on the Telnyx network. If this is disabled, Telnyx will be able to use T38 on just one leg of the call depending on each leg's settings.

member.summary: Identifies the type of the resource.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.AniNumberFormat
member.summary: This setting allows you to set the format with which the caller's number (ANI) is sent for inbound phone calls.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.ChannelLimit
member.summary: When set, this will limit the total number of inbound calls to phone numbers associated with this connection. Default: null

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.Codecs
member.summary: Defines the list of codecs that Telnyx will send for inbound calls to a specific number on your portal account, in priority order. This only works when the Connection the number is assigned to uses Media Handling mode: default. OPUS and H.264 codecs are available only when using TCP or TLS transport for SIP. Default: ["G722","G711U","G711A","G729","OPUS","H.264"]

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.DnisNumberFormat
member.summary: Default: "e164". Options: ["+e164","e164","national"]

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.GenerateRingbackTone
member.summary: Generate ringback tone through 183 session progress message with early media.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.IsupHeadersEnabled
member.summary: When set, inbound phone calls will receive ISUP parameters via SIP headers. (Only when available and only when using TCP or TLS transport.) Default: false

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.PrackEnabled
member.summary: Enable PRACK messages as defined in RFC3262.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.PrivacyZoneEnabled
member.summary: By default, Telnyx does not send caller-id information when the caller has chosen to hide this information. When this option is enabled, Telnyx will send the SIP header Privacy:id plus the caller-id information so that the receiver side can choose when to hide it.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.SipCompactHeadersEnabled
member.summary: Defaults to true;

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.Timeout1XxSecs
member.summary: Time(sec) before aborting if connection is not made (min: 1, max: 20). Default: "3"

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Inbound.Timeout2XxSecs
member.summary: Time(sec) before aborting if call is unanswered (min: 1, max: 600). Default: "90"

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Outbound.AniOverride
member.summary: Set a phone number as the ani_override value to override caller id number on outbound calls. Default = "".

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Outbound.AniOverrideType
member.summary: Specifies when we apply your ani_override setting. Only applies when ani_override is not blank. Default: always

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Outbound.CallParkingEnabled
member.summary: Forces all SIP calls originated on this connection to be "parked" instead of "bridged" to the destination specified on the URI. Parked calls will return ringback to the caller and will await for a Call Control command to define which action will be taken next.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Outbound.ChannelLimit
member.summary: When set, this will limit the total number of outbound calls to phone numbers associated with this connection. Default: null

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Outbound.GenerateRingbackTone
member.summary: Generate ringback tone through 183 session progress message with early media.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Outbound.InstantRingbackEnabled
member.summary: When set, ringback will not wait for indication before sending ringback tone to calling party.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Outbound.Localization
member.summary: A 2-character country code specifying the country whose national dialing rules should be used. For example, if set to `US` then any US number can be dialed without preprending +1 to the number. When left blank, Telnyx will try US and GB dialing rules, in that order, by default. Default : null.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Outbound.OutboundVoiceProfileId
member.summary: Identifies the associated outbound voice profile

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.Outbound.T38ReinviteSource
member.summary: This setting only affects connections with Fax-type Outbound Voice Profiles. The setting dictates whether or not Telnyx sends a t.38 reinvite By default, Telnyx will send the re-invite. If set to `customer`, the caller is expected to send the t.38 reinvite. Default: telnyx. Options: ["telnyx","customer","disabled","passthru","caller-passthru","callee-passthru"]

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.RtcpSettings.Port
member.summary: RTCP port by default is rtp+1, it can also be set to rtcp-mux Default: "rtp+1"

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.RtcpSettings.ReportEnabled
member.summary: DEPRECATED - RTCP reports are always sent to customers/vendors. For backwards compatibility, the value is always true.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.RtcpSettings.ReportFrequencySeconds
member.summary: RTCP reports are sent to customers based on the frequency set. Frequency is in seconds and it can be set to values from 5 to 3000 seconds. Default: 10

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.CredentialConnections.CredentialConnection.UserName
member.summary: The user name to be used as part of the credentials. Must be 4-32 characters long and alphanumeric values only (no spaces or special characters).

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.CredentialConnections.CredentialConnection.SipUriCallingPreference
member.summary: This feature enables inbound SIP URI calls to your Credential Auth Connection. If enabled for all (unrestricted) then anyone who calls the SIP URI @telnyx.com will be connected to your Connection. You can also choose to allow only calls that are originated on any Connections under your account (internal). Options: [ "disabled","unrestricted","internal ]

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Connections.CredentialConnections.CredentialConnection.Password
member.summary: The password to be used as part of the credentials. Must be 8 to 128 characters long.

member.summary: The mobile operator two-character (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) origin country code.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Wireless.MobileOperatorNetworks.MobileOperatorNetworksRecord.Mcc
member.summary:
MCC stands for Mobile Country Code. It's a three decimal digit that identifies a country.

This code is commonly seen joined with a Mobile Network Code (MNC) in a tuple that allows identifying a carrier known as PLMN (Public Land Mobile Network) code.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Wireless.MobileOperatorNetworks.MobileOperatorNetworksRecord.Mnc
member.summary:
MNC stands for Mobile Network Code. It's a two to three decimal digits that identify a network.

This code is commonly seen joined with a Mobile Country Code (MCC) in a tuple that allows identifying a carrier known as PLMN (Public Land Mobile Network) code.

member.summary: Sim Card record

member.summary: Gets or sets id.

member.summary: Gets or Sets RecordType

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Wireless.SimCards.SimCardRecord.Status
member.summary:
The current status of the SIM card. It will be one of the following:
  • activating - the card is being activated
  • active - the card is active and ready for use
  • inactivating - the card is being inactivated
  • inactive - the card has been inactivated and cannot be used
  • data_limit_exceeded - the card has exceeded its data consumption limit
Transitioning between the active and inactive states may take a period of time.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Wireless.SimCards.SimCardRecord.Iccid
member.summary: The ICCID is the identifier of the specific SIM card/chip. Each SIM is internationally identified by its integrated circuit card identifier (ICCID). ICCIDs are stored in the SIM card's memory and are also engraved or printed on the SIM card body during a process called personalization.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Wireless.SimCards.SimCardRecord.Imsi
member.summary:
SIM cards are identified on their individual operator networks by a unique International Mobile Subscriber Identity (IMSI).
Mobile network operators connect mobile phone calls and communicate with their market SIM cards using their IMSIs. The IMSI is stored in the Subscriber Identity Module (SIM) inside the device and is sent by the device to the appropriate network. It is used to acquire the details of the device in the Home Location Register (HLR) or the Visitor Location Register (VLR).

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Entities.Wireless.SimCards.SimCardRecord.Msisdn
member.summary:
Mobile Station International Subscriber Directory Number (MSISDN) is a number used to identify a mobile phone number internationally.
MSISDN is defined by the E.164 numbering plan. It includes a country code and a National Destination Code which identifies the subscriber's operator.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Services.Calls.ConferenceCommands.Participants.DialParticipantOptions.SupervisorRole
member.summary: Sets the joining participant as a supervisor for the conference. A conference can have multiple supervisors. "barge" means the supervisor enters the conference as a normal participant. This is the same as "none". "monitor" means the supervisor is muted but can hear all participants. "whisper" means that only the specified "whisper_call_control_ids" can hear the supervisor. Defaults to "none".

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Services.Calls.ConferenceCommands.Participants.DialParticipantOptions.WhisperCallControlIds
member.summary: Array of unique call_control_ids the joining supervisor can whisper to. If none provided, the supervisor will join the conference as a monitoring participant only.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Services.Calls.Models.AnsweringMachineDetectionConfig.TotalAnalysisTimeMillis

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Services.Connections.UpsertConnectionOptions.EncodeContactHeaderEnabled

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Services.Connections.UpsertConnectionOptions.EncryptedMedia

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Services.Connections.UpsertConnectionOptions.OnnetT38PassthroughEnabled
member.summary: Enable on-net T38 if you prefer the sender and receiver negotiating T38 directly if both are on the Telnyx network. If this is disabled, Telnyx will be able to use T38 on just one leg of the call depending on each leg's settings.

member.name: P:Telnyx.net.Services.Wireless.SimCards.UpdateSimCardOptions.Status
member.summary:
The current status of the SIM card. It will be one of the following:
  • activating - the card is being activated
  • active - the card is active and ready for use
  • inactivating - the card is being inactivated
  • inactive - the card has been inactivated and cannot be used
  • data_limit_exceeded - the card has exceeded its data consumption limit
Transitioning between the active and inactive states may take a period of time.

member.name: P:Telnyx.MessagingProfileUpdate.UrlShortenerSettings
member.summary:
The URL shortener feature allows automatic replacement of URLs that were generated using a public URL shortener service.Some examples include bit.do, bit.ly, goo.gl, ht.ly, is.gd, ow.ly, rebrand.ly, t.co, tiny.cc, and tinyurl.com.Such URLs are replaced with with links generated by Telnyx. The use of custom links can improve branding and message deliverability.
To disable this feature, set the object field to `null`.

member.summary:
Number Pool allows you to send messages from a pool of numbers of different types, assigning weights to each type.The pool consists of all the long code and toll free numbers assigned to the messaging profile.
To disable this feature, set the object field to `null`.

member.name: P:Telnyx.NewMessagingProfile.UrlShortenerSettings
member.summary:
The URL shortener feature allows automatic replacement of URLs that were generated using a public URL shortener service.Some examples include bit.do, bit.ly, goo.gl, ht.ly, is.gd, ow.ly, rebrand.ly, t.co, tiny.cc, and tinyurl.com.Such URLs are replaced with with links generated by Telnyx. The use of custom links can improve branding and message deliverability.
To disable this feature, set the object field to `null`.

member.name: T:Telnyx.NumberPoolSettings
member.summary: Number Pool allows you to send messages from a pool of numbers of different types, assigning weights to each type. The pool consists of all the Long Code and Toll Free numbers assigned to the Messaging profile.

member.name: P:Telnyx.NumberPoolSettings.TollFreeWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets defines the probability weight for a Toll Free number to be selected when sending a message. The higher the weight the higher the probability. The sum of the weights for all number types does not necessarily need to add to 100. Weight must be a non-negative number, and when equal to zero it will remove the number type from the pool.
member.value: Defines the probability weight for a Toll Free number to be selected when sending a message. The higher the weight the higher the probability. The sum of the weights for all number types does not necessarily need to add to 100. Weight must be a non-negative number, and when equal to zero it will remove the number type from the pool.

member.name: P:Telnyx.NumberPoolSettings.LongCodeWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets defines the probability weight for a Long Code number to be selected when sending a message. The higher the weight the higher the probability. The sum of the weights for all number types does not necessarily need to add to 100. Weight must be a non-negative number, and when equal to zero it will remove the number type from the pool.
member.value: Defines the probability weight for a Long Code number to be selected when sending a message. The higher the weight the higher the probability. The sum of the weights for all number types does not necessarily need to add to 100. Weight must be a non-negative number, and when equal to zero it will remove the number type from the pool.

member.name: P:Telnyx.NumberPoolSettings.SkipUnhealthy
member.summary: Gets or sets if set to true all unhealthy numbers will be automatically removed from the pool. Health metrics per number are calculated on a regular basis, taking into account the deliverability rate and the amount of messages marked as spam by upstream carriers. Numbers with a deliverability rate below 25% or spam ratio over 75% will be considered unhealthy.
member.value: If set to true all unhealthy numbers will be automatically removed from the pool. Health metrics per number are calculated on a regular basis, taking into account the deliverability rate and the amount of messages marked as spam by upstream carriers. Numbers with a deliverability rate below 25% or spam ratio over 75% will be considered unhealthy.

member.name: P:Telnyx.NumberPoolSettings.StickySender
member.summary: Gets or sets if set to true, Number Pool will try to choose the same sending number for all messages to a particular recipient. If the sending number becomes unhealthy and `skip_unhealthy` is set to `true`, a new number will be chosen.
member.value: If set to true, Number Pool will try to choose the same sending number for all messages to a particular recipient. If the sending number becomes unhealthy and `skip_unhealthy` is set to `true`, a new number will be chosen.

member.name: P:Telnyx.NumberPoolSettings.Geomatch
member.summary: Gets or sets if set to true, Number Pool will try to choose a sending number with the same area code as the destination number. If there are no such numbers available, a nunber with a different area code will be chosen. Currently only NANP numbers are supported.
member.value: If set to true, Number Pool will try to choose a sending number with the same area code as the destination number. If there are no such numbers available, a nunber with a different area code will be chosen. Currently only NANP numbers are supported.

member.name: T:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions
member.summary: CallControlDialCreateOptions.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.To
member.summary: The DID or SIP URI to dial out to.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.From
member.summary: The `from` number to be used as the caller id presented to the destination (`to` number). The number should be in +E164 format. This attribute will default to the `from` number of the original call if omitted.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.FromDisplayName
member.summary: The `from_display_name` string to be used as the caller id name (SIP From Display Name) presented to the destination (`to` number). The string should have a maximum of 128 characters, containing only letters, numbers, spaces, and -_~!.+ special characters. If ommited, the display name will be the same as the number in the `from` field. Example: "Company Name"

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.ConnectionId
member.summary: The ID of the connection to be used when dialing the destination.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.AudioUrl
member.summary: The URL of a file to be played back to the callee when the call is answered. The URL can point to either a WAV or MP3 file.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.TimeoutSecs
member.summary: The number of seconds that Telnyx will wait for the call to be answered by the destination to which it is being called. If the timeout is reached before an answer is received, the call will hangup and a `call.hangup` webhook with a `hangup_cause` of `timeout` will be sent. Minimum value is 5 seconds. Maximum value is 120 seconds. Default: 30 Example: 60.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.TimeLimitSecs
member.summary: Sets the maximum duration of a Call Control Leg in seconds. If the time limit is reached, the call will hangup and a `call.hangup` webhook with a `hangup_cause` of `time_limit` will be sent. For example, by setting a time limit of 120 seconds, a Call Leg will be automatically terminated two minutes after being answered. The default time limit is 14400 seconds or 4 hours and this is also the maximum allowed call length. Default: 14400 Example: 600

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.AnsweringMachineDetection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value Enables Answering Machine Detection. When a call is answered, Telnyx runs real-time detection to determine if it was picked up by a human or a machine and sends an `call.machine.detection.ended` webhook with the analysis result. If 'greeting_end' or 'detect_words' is used and a 'machine' is detected, you will receive another 'call.machine.greeting.ended' webhook when the answering machine greeting ends with a beep or silence. If `detect_beep` is used, you will only receive 'call.machine.greeting.ended' if a beep is detected.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.AnsweringMachineDetConfig
member.summary: Optional config parameter to modify answering_machine_detection performance.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.ClientState
member.summary: Gets or sets use this field to add state to every subsequent webhook. It must be a valid Base-64 encoded string.

member.summary: Gets or sets use this field to avoid duplicate commands. Telnyx will ignore commands with the same "command_id".

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlDialOptions.LinkTo
member.summary: Use another call's control id for sharing the same call session id.
member.value: Example: "ilditnZK_eVysupV21KzmzN_sM29ygfauQojpm4BgFtfX5hXAcjotg==".

member.name: T:Telnyx.CallControlForkStartOptions
member.summary: CallControlForkStartCreateOptions.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlForkStartOptions.Target
member.summary: The network target, , where the call's RTP media packets should be forwarded. Both incoming and outgoing media packets will be delivered to the specified target, and information about the stream will be included in the encapsulation protocol header, including the direction (0 = inbound; 1 = outbound), leg (0 = A-leg; 1 = B-leg), and call_leg_id. Example: "udp:192.0.2.1:9000".

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlForkStartOptions.Rx
member.summary: The network target, , where the call's incoming RTP media packets should be forwarded. Example: "192.0.2.1:9000".

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlForkStartOptions.Tx
member.summary: The network target, , where the call's outgoing RTP media packets should be forwarded. Example: "192.0.2.1:9001".

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlForkStartOptions.ClientState
member.summary: Use this field to add state to every subsequent webhook. It must be a valid Base-64 encoded string. Example: "aGF2ZSBhIG5pY2UgZGF5ID1d".

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlForkStartOptions.CommandId
member.summary: Use this field to avoid duplicate commands. Telnyx will ignore commands with the same `command_id`. Example: "891510ac-f3e4-11e8-af5b-de00688a4901".

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.AudioUrl
member.summary: The URL of a file to be played back to the callee when the call is answered. The URL can point to either a WAV or MP3 file.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.TimeoutSecs
member.summary: The number of seconds that Telnyx will wait for the call to be answered by the destination to which it is being called. If the timeout is reached before an answer is received, the call will hangup and a `call.hangup` webhook with a `hangup_cause` of `timeout` will be sent. Minimum value is 5 seconds. Maximum value is 120 seconds. Default: 30 Example: 60.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.TimeLimitSecs
member.summary: Sets the maximum duration of a Call Control Leg in seconds. If the time limit is reached, the call will hangup and a `call.hangup` webhook with a `hangup_cause` of `time_limit` will be sent. For example, by setting a time limit of 120 seconds, a Call Leg will be automatically terminated two minutes after being answered. The default time limit is 14400 seconds or 4 hours and this is also the maximum allowed call length. Default: 14400 Example: 600

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.AnsweringMachineDetection
member.summary: Gets or sets a value Enables Answering Machine Detection. When a call is answered, Telnyx runs real-time detection to determine if it was picked up by a human or a machine and sends an `call.machine.detection.ended` webhook with the analysis result. If 'greeting_end' or 'detect_words' is used and a 'machine' is detected, you will receive another 'call.machine.greeting.ended' webhook when the answering machine greeting ends with a beep or silence. If `detect_beep` is used, you will only receive 'call.machine.greeting.ended' if a beep is detected.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.AnsweringMachineDetConfig
member.summary: Optional config parameter to modify answering_machine_detection performance.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.ClientState
member.summary: Gets or sets use this field to add state to every subsequent webhook. It must be a valid Base-64 encoded string.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.CommandId
member.summary: Gets or sets use this field to avoid duplicate commands. Telnyx will ignore commands with the same "command_id".

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.LinkTo
member.summary: Use another call's control id for sharing the same call session id.
member.value: Example: "ilditnZK_eVysupV21KzmzN_sM29ygfauQojpm4BgFtfX5hXAcjotg==".

member.summary: SIP Authentication username used for SIP challenges.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.SipAuthPassword
member.summary: SIP Authentication password used for SIP challenges.

member.name: P:Telnyx.CallControlTransferOptions.WebhookUrl
member.summary: Use this field to override the URL for which Telnyx will send subsequent webhooks to for this call.

member.summary: HTTP request type used for `webhook_url`.
